fields.Title: Promoting Community Resilience to Critical Events Through Implementation of a Community-based, Interdisciplinary Education Module
fields.Outlet (if applicable): SSPA is providing one month's summer salary for Drs. Yu and Hubbard; Arts and Sciences is providing summer salary for Dr. Brand, in 2015
fields.Description/Abstract:
Map Your Hazards has been developed, scoped, and tested in Boise, Idaho.  The next phase will partner with emergency planners and educators in Seattle to develop a teaching and learning module for students to map the hazards to their local communities and make specific, actionable recommendations to local emergency managers.
Partners:  Students and faculty at three to five community colleges in Seattle metro area; emergency planners in Seattle metro area
Description of Partner:  Map Your Hazards will partner with emergency planners and educators in Seattle to develop a teaching and learning module for students to map the hazards to their local communities and make specific, actionable recommendations to local emergency managers.
Role:  Co-Principal
